name: Gerry
text: Great location and super friendly staff.

name: The
text: Loved the location near the very authentic market. It’s the real Morocco and I loved how so kind everyone was. The swimming pool is small but water is warm and clean and never busy.Food in the restaurant is lovely and really reasonable compared to the surrounding areas. They have the best mint tea I had for 10 dirhams. Walking distance to the beach. There is the devils rock close by but didn’t have time to go there.The local market had lovely fresh bread which we’d buy every day. We also tried the fish in the stalls- a whole plate of freshly fried fish with lemon wedges and chilli peppers and a loaf of fresh bread- only 20 Dirhams- less than 2 sterling and enough for both of us. Bought my tagine pottery from the local market beautiful. The staff were all so very welcoming. We would definitely come again.

name: Miranda
text: Nice pool, friendly staff, fine breakfast. Hotelrooms can use a makeover, but they are functional.

name: Laurie
text: The staff were really nice! And there is a free parking in front of the hotel.

name: Hicham
text: Not good with the price I paid

name: Tarek
text: Was very nice and nice people

name: Helena
text: We booked the room for 3nights, but we left after the first night because the room was not clean, and there was a cockroach in the bathroom. Would not recommend this place at all if you want a decent stay for your money.

name: John
text: This is a nice hotel in a quiet little seaside town but close to Agadir.
